title: Hey look, our one teammate who is really good at pressuring the map is pushing
body:

Idk, how do you teach the Fiora with no escape that pushing past the ward line is a bad idea no matter how fed she is?

You wouldn't get caught if you had vision where you were splitting and retreated before you can get collapsed on.  It's your fault if you get caught splitting, your team can't do anything about that.

If Fiora gets murdered trying to ult onto the adc because their team has peel, then she can at least melt a tower with half a minion wave at least. Buuuuut if the crew has all come after her and no one is doing anything about it, go out in a blaze of glory.

IMO, a splitter should take TP if planning to splitpush. Wards are important but if you can't rely on your teammates to split the enemy up, you can do it yourself. Give yourself 5 seconds before the closest cc can get you, and poof, you're at bot lane (from top) while they run all the way down to get you (and you eat their bot turret during that time). I did that using revive/tele {{champion:11}} and surprised myself by winning a few games with scores like 2/14/0

But if you watch the minimap and pay attention to when the enemy team disappears you can just walk away while they send several people to where you used to be at zero losses for your team.  Split pushing doesn't mean "push every wave all the way into the tower no matter what and hope your team can do the same."

And hey, if they're farming at least they're pushing waves, catching up, or gaining an experience lead while the other team deathballs around the map looking for picks.

But if you're dying to a goon squad regularly then it's your fault.  Plain and simple.  Your job when splitting is to pressure without dying, otherwise there's no point in splitting.  Watch the minimap and don't go past the dark place without vision on at least 4 members of their team.  It's a very simple concept.

That is all well and good, but think about it like this. You know you have the map pressure and can melt a tower the moment you get a wave to it. The enemy team knows that as well. However, your own team doesn't know how to abuse that information. They won't force a lane towards their side to keep them split. They won't put down any wards outside of a 1000 unit radius around whatever they're around. They'll put wards in bushes directly next to them.

When 4 people decide to leave after you have made progress, you don't really know where they'll come from since a 3 ward limit gives you only so many choke points such as from behind, a point on the river and the nearest lane entrance. It could be the entire team coming from one path you didn't ward and you won't know until its too late. Is your death worth it? No. Because your team is to petrified to even push up a wave. Sure the enemy team blows 3 ultimates on you, but you can bet your ass they will still find a way to win versus the 4 incompetents that matchmaking placed you with.

Grouping gets you killed. Doing things alone gets you killed slower. Not a way out from that.
